abstract: Apple’s annual presentation at Macworld was a dull affair. The big news: copy restrictions will be removed from iTunes songs.
snippet: Apple’s annual presentation at Macworld was a dull affair. The big news: copy restrictions will be removed from iTunes songs.
lead_paragraph: I’m reporting from the keynote speech by Philip W. Schiller, Apple’s senior vice president of worldwide product marketing, at Macworld Expo in San Francisco. We’ll keep updating this post for the duration of the speech, with the latest news at the top. Time stamps are New York time.

headline.main: Macworld Live Blog: Apple to Lift Copy Limits on iTunes Music

abstract: Apple said it would begin selling song downloads without anticopying measures and change its pricing structure.
snippet: Apple said it would begin selling song downloads without anticopying measures and change its pricing structure.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  In moves that will help shape the online future of the music business, Apple said Tuesday that it would remove anticopying restrictions on all of the songs in its popular iTunes Store and allow record companies to set a range of prices for them.

headline.main: Want to Copy iTunes Music? Go Ahead, Apple Says
headline.print_headline: Copy an iTunes Song? Go Ahead, Apple Says

abstract: Tuesday afternoon’s news that Dr. Sanjay Gupta is being considered for the position of surgeon general took many by surprise, even within CNN, where he has worked since 2001.
snippet: Tuesday afternoon’s news that Dr. Sanjay Gupta is being considered for the position of surgeon general took many by surprise, even within CNN, where he has worked since 2001.
lead_paragraph: There was Dr. Sanjay Gupta on CNN Tuesday morning, talking about the condition of Steve Jobs, the Apple founder who had disclosed that he was suffering from a hormonal imbalance.

headline.main: From the Operating Room to the Television Studio to … Washington?
